2$Condition: Other$2/1/2010 6:20:36 PM$Reviewer: Think twice, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver) $1$1$1$As a caregiver, I have given this IM many times, and most patients don't care for it.  I've actually had some ask for Thorazine instead.  Even thought its given slowly, most tell me that the Zyprexa is tougher to receive that Thorazine.  Hope this helps.
3$Condition: Agitation associated with Bipolar Mania$9/24/2009 12:33:04 PM$Reviewer: chewbacca, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$3$1$20mg of Zyprexa is the only thing that is keeping me from bipolar/suicidal tendancies. Ease of use is low because I sleep 12 hours and am groggy for another 3-5 hours aftwards. My doc says there is a histamine effact that does not go away on lower doses
4$Condition: Other$12/27/2008 1:21:46 PM$Reviewer: 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver) $1$1$1$once i was started on Zyphexa on admittion to hospital
In less than 6 weeks in the hospitl
column2: I was not able to walk
column5: I began to drool and could barely talk.  I was told I was suffering from Parkinson.

column1: Once I was discharged my family took me to a neurologist and he admitted to another hospital and took me off the zyphexa.  In less than one week I stopped the drolling
column2: I was able to swallow and with the help of OT
column3: PT and Speech therpy I was able to be moved to the Rehab side of the hospital.

column1: I feel like a new person and I feel now it was all due to the medicine as the neurologist felt was the problem.
What a nightmare for me and my family to have to go through while you were in a hospital seeking help."
